newsitem.title: CHINA: Mild earthquake shakes China's Tibet region.
newsitem.headline: Mild earthquake shakes China's Tibet region.

text.p: An earthquake measuring 5.2 on the open-ended Richter scale jolted a remote area of China's Tibet region but there were no immediate reports of casualties or damage, officials said on Saturday.
The tremor struck at 12.47 p.m. (0447 GMT) on Saturday in Baxoi county in the southeastern corner of the Himalayan region, an official with the State Seismological Bureau said.
The earthquake's epicentre was in a mountainous region near the county town, but there were no reports of injuries or damage, an official with the Tibet Seismological Bureau said by telephone.

A tremor of 5.3 magnitude jolted Baxoi in May, and local seismologists had forecast in June that a quake measuring five to six on the Richter scale would hit Baxoi, the Xinhua news agency said but gave no details.
